comment: Prof. Nijim is a good choice for communication systems. He tries to explain the difficult material in an easy to understand way, and understands what is or what isn't too difficult for an exam. He really cares about the students and will curve if he feels it is necessary. Attending the lectures is a must as the test material comes right out of them

He lectures alot but curve 2 of the 3 test. he gives alot of extra credit. He will work with you if he see you in class often and trying. THis is a side job for him so he is a bit unorganized but he is pretty fair. He will tell you what he is looking for on tests.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: The most important thing to know is that he does NOT use D2L at all, takes awhile to get used to that. All notes are taken in class, so class is very important. Homework is given to you on the board and you have to copy it down. He is very nice and gives fair tests. This is his part time job so he does not care that much.

Pros: -Nice -Answers questions -Very flexible with homework deadlines Cons: -Doesn't stick to syllabus -Uses a book that's hard to get & full of errors -Bizarre grading on exams -Doesn't post anything on d2l -Hardly communicates outside class -Hard to read writing -Never seems prepared -Lectures from a printout (that he doesn't post)
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: Nijim is a pretty good teacher. any question thrown at him he can answer. His notes are a bit difficult to read at first but you get used to it. learn to write quickly and listen at the same time and you'll get the most out of his class. Most students just beg him for free A's while not paying attention but just put forth the effort n ull be fine.

He teaches me Communication system. It should be a easy class, but he makes me confused sometimes. Lots of blackboard-writing that I have to write down course notes as quick as possible.I miss some stuff oftentimes.
Great professor. He gives sufficient explanations with good notes on the board. He's very nice and helpful too.
Dr. Nijim is very nice and helpful. He's definitely one of my favorite professors in EE department.

Dr. Nijim is absolutely awesome. He's extremely helpful and nice to the students. He tries his best to make everyone interested in his subject. His goal is basically students' learning, not their grade.  I'm planning to take more classes with him.
